definition: tastes as if one is chewing wax (idiom)/tasteless/insipid

sentences.english: A big reason is that it's all like eating sawdust .
sentences.chinese: 一个主要原因是这个过程味如嚼蜡。

sentences.english: Lab work is dull and repetitious .
sentences.chinese: 实验室里的工作味同嚼蜡翻来复去。

sentences.english: See go to very delicious object, chew unexpectedly like chew a wax.
sentences.chinese: 看去很美味的东西，嚼起来竟如同嚼蜡。

sentences.english: Some low-fat cheeses have quite an acceptable flavor but some taste like rubber.
sentences.chinese: 有些低脂奶酪味道不错，但有些吃起来就味同嚼蜡了。

sentences.english: See go to very savory object, chew unexpectedly like chew a wax.
sentences.chinese: 看去很美味的东西，嚼起来竟如同嚼蜡。

definition: tastes as if one is chewing wax (idiom)/tasteless/insipid
lit. to eat without tasting the food/worried or downhearted (idiom)
to lose all interest in life (idiom)
lit. to be hardly worth eating, but it would still be a pity to discard it (idiom)/fig. some things have little to no value, yet one is still reluctant to part with them
pinyin: shi2 zhi1 wu2 wei4 , qi4 zhi1 ke3 xi1

definition: to swallow in one gulp (idiom)/(fig.) to accept without thinking/to lap up
exotic delicacies/luxury foodstuff from distant locations
eloquence that generates perfume (idiom); profound and significant text
to wolf down one's food (idiom); to devour ravenously/to gorge oneself
